replies.msg:
Sarri on Fabregas injury: "The best news is Fabregas, he is now very well. He is training with the team during the week, so now he has only to improve his physical condition. I think in a few days or one week, he will be ready to play." #CFC

Sarri says Chelsea have some injuries from the international break: "Yesterday there were some problems for Emerson and Zappacosta. A little problem after the national team for Loftus-Cheek, with the right tibia" #CFC

Sarri on Chelsea re-signing John Terry: "Last time I spoke to him, he says he wants to play for another season. I don't know the situation but Chelsea is his home. Yes, of course [I would sign him]. He would be a point of reference for me. He told me he wants to play." #CFC
Sarri on Ampadu game time: "In the future, I think I will be able to give him space. To give space to Hudson-Odoi and Loftus-Cheek. They are very young and they are the future of the club." #CFC
Sarri on lack of chances for Ampadu: "For me, in this period. It was important to not change especially in the defensive line. I hope in future to change." #CFC

quote.msg: Sarri on Chelsea re-signing John Terry: "Last time I spoke to him, he says he wants to play for another season. I don't know the situation but Chelsea is his home. Yes, of course [I would sign him]. He would be a point of reference for me. He told me he wants to play." #CFC

replies.msg: Sarri on Terry turning down Russia: "If he wants to play for another season, I think it is right he tries to play, if he tries to help us then I will be very very happy" #CFC

Sarri on captain decision: "I have my idea, I have decided, but i would like to wait before I tell you my decision to speak with the players and the club. For the moment, the captain is Azpilicueta, I will tell you the final decision after I talk with the players and club" #CFC

https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11668/11499603/chelsea-feared-eden-hazard-exit-under-antonio-conte-matt-law-tells-sunday-supplement
SkySport å°ˆè¨ª Matt Law

"After Belgium beat England in the World Cup, Hazard gave an interview where he basically said he wanted to go to Real Madrid, Chelsea never really had any worries about him," Law said.

"They were categorical that they were not going to sell him and they knew he was not going to kick off. They were relaxed by the fact he would be fine and they would not suffer any problems.

"They knew he would not be like Thibaut Courtois, who went AWOL to get his move to Madrid over the line. They knew Hazard would not sulk and would be absolutely fine.

"That was the problem at the end of Conte's tenure. He didn't feel free and there was a real big fear at Chelsea that if Conte had stayed that would be when Hazard would look to go.

"It wouldn't have been about going to a bigger club, it would have been about his own personal happiness. He's got the smile back now."

replies.msg:
Ethan Ampadu has signed a new five-year contract at Chelsea.

The Welshman, who can play in defence or midfield, already has seven Chelsea appearances to his name and is a full international.

Upon signing his new deal, Ampadu, who turned 18 last week, said: ‘I’m really proud and happy. I’m looking forward to the next five years and all I have got to do now is continue to work hard, and hopefully good things will happen.’

Chelsea director Marina Granovskaia added: ‘Ethan has shown great potential and unbelievable maturity since arriving at Chelsea a year ago. In this short time he convinced a lot of people with his exceptional quality and mentality and we look forward to watching him develop into a key player for the club over the coming years.’

Ampadu joined Chelsea from Exeter City in the summer of 2017, and having begun his first season in west London playing for our Academy sides, he made his senior debut in a Carabao Cup third round win against Nottingham Forest at the Bridge. He had only turned 17 a few days earlier.

He then played the whole 90 minutes in the next round of the competition against Everton, and impressed in a deep-lying central midfield position. In doing so, he became the first player born after the turn of the Millennium to start a game for Chelsea.


ETHAN AMPADU TAKING ON EVERTON LAST SEASON
Ampadu appeared in four more cup games after that in 2017/18, also playing in the Academy sides’ biggest fixtures before a serious injury put an early end to what had been a fantastic first season at Chelsea.

During that first campaign, he also made his first two appearances for the Welsh national team in friendly matches against France and Panama, and recently starred during the Nations League victory over Ireland having enjoyed a promising pre-season with the Blues.
